pt: {sc}negligent{/sc} {sc}neglectful{/sc} {sc}lax{/sc} {sc}slack{/sc} {sc}remiss{/sc} mean culpably careless or indicative of such carelessness. {sc}negligent{/sc} implies inattention to one's duty or business.

pt.t: {it}negligent{/it} about writing a note of thanks

pt: {sc}neglectful{/sc} adds a more disapproving implication of laziness or deliberate inattention.

pt.t: a society callously {it}neglectful{/it} of the poor

pt: {sc}lax{/sc} implies a blameworthy lack of strictness, severity, or precision.
{sc}slack{/sc} implies want of due or necessary diligence or care.
{sc}remiss{/sc} implies blameworthy carelessness shown in slackness, forgetfulness, or neglect.

pt.t: had been {it}remiss{/it} in their familial duties

et: Middle English {it}slak{/it}, from Old English {it}sleac{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}slah{/it} slack, Latin {it}laxus{/it} slack, loose, {it}languēre{/it} to languish, Greek {it}lagnos{/it} lustful and perhaps to Greek {it}lēgein{/it} to stop
shortdef: not using due diligence, care, or dispatch : negligent
characterized by slowness, sluggishness, or lack of energy
moderate in some quality; especially : moderately warm
